common

Dataset

DatasetBuilder

class DatasetBuilder(VIDEOS, OUTPUT_DIR_PATH, log_name, IMAGE_DIMENSIONS, SOURCE_DIR)

Bases: abc.ABC

This class builds the sub-datasets. It takes videos, extracts the frames and saves them on the disk, with the corresponding labels. It also applies data augmentation transforms to the training sub-dataset

Parameters

  • VIDEOS (List of strings) – The names of the videos that belong to this sub-dataset

  • OUTPUT_DIR_PATH (String) – Path of the directory that will contain the images and labels pairs

  • log_name (String) – Name to be displayed alongside the progress bar in the terminal

ANNOTATIONS_DIR = 'annotations'
ROOT_PATH = '/home/runner/work/RAVE/RAVE/docs'
VIDEOS_DIR = 'videos'

static create_directory_if_does_not_exist(path)

Creates a directory if it does not exist on the disk

Parameters

path (string) – The path of the directory to create

create_images_dataset_with_one_video(file_name, video_path, annotations)

Creates the images and labels pair of the video and saves them to disk

Parameters

  • file_name (String) – Name of the video

  • video_path (String) – Path to the video

  • annotations (List of strings) – One string per frame. Each string represents the ellipse that is present on the frame

create_images_of_one_video_group()

Gets the info of one video, then creates the images and labels pair of the video and save them to disk

Used to get the 3 DatasetBuilder objects (one for each sub-dataset)

Saves the image and label pair to disk

Parameters

  • output_image_tensor (pytorch tensor) – The image that will be saved to disk

  • label (List) – The label that will be saved to disk

Trainer

image_utils

apply_image_rotation(image_tensor, rotation_angle_extremums=[- 0.1, 0.1])

A data augmentation operation, rotates the frame randomly, by selecting an angle in the ‘rotation_angle_extremums’range. This should be used instead of the pytorch transform if you wish to know the amplitude of the rotation.

Parameters

  • image_tensor (pytorch tensor) – The frame on which to apply the rotation

  • rotation_angle_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of the rotation angle. Defaults to [-0.1, 0.1]

Returns

The rotated frame (pytorch tensor) and the rotation angle (float)

Return type

Tuple

apply_image_translation(image_tensor, x_extremums=[- 0.2, 0.2], y_extremums=[- 0.2, 0.2])

A data augmentation operation, translates the frame randomly, by selecting an x and y value in the x_extremums and y_extremums ranges, respectively.This should be used instead of the pytorch transform if you wish to know the amplitude of the translation.

Parameters

  • image_tensor (pytorch tensor) – The frame on which to apply the translation

  • x_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of the x translation. Defaults to [-0.2, 0.2]

  • y_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of the y translation. Defaults to [-0.2, 0.2]

Returns

The translated frame (pytorch tensor), the x offset (float) and the y offset (float)

Return type

Tuple

apply_image_translation_and_rotation(image_tensor, x_extremums=[- 0.2, 0.2], y_extremums=[- 0.2, 0.2], rotation_angle_extremums=[- 0.1, 0.1])

A data augmentation operation,translates and rotates the frame randomly, by selecting an x and y value in the x_extremums and y_extremums ranges, respectively, and by selecting an angle in the ‘rotation_angle_extremums’range. This should be used instead of the pytorch transform if you wish to know the amplitude of the translation and the rotation.

Parameters

  • image_tensor (pytorch tensor) – The frame on which to apply the translation

  • x_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of the x translation. Defaults to [-0.2, 0.2]

  • y_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of the y translation. Defaults to [-0.2, 0.2]

  • rotation_angle_extremums (list, optional) – The min and max value of therotation angle. Defaults to [-0.1, 0.1]

Returns

The translated frame (pytorch tensor), the x offset (float),the y offset (float) and the rotation angle (float)

Return type

Tuple

do_affine_grid_operation(image_tensor, translation=(0, 0), phi=0)

Executes the affine operation

Parameters

  • image_tensor (pytorch tensor) – The image on which to apply the operation

  • translation (Tuple) – The magnitude of the translation operation

  • phi (float) – The angle of rotation

Returns

The processed image

Return type

pytorch tensor

inverse_normalize(tensor, mean, std)

Undo the normalization operation that was performed on an image when it was passed to a network

Parameters

  • mean (float) – The mean that was used for the normalization

  • std (float) – The std that was used for the normalization

Returns

The unormalized image

Return type
